meanings.definition: To cause a short circuit in (an electrical device)
meanings.sent1: I accidentally shorted the wires and the lights went out.
meanings.sent2: He shorted the circuit by touching the exposed wires together.
meanings.sent3: The robot shorted out when I connected the wrong cables - oops!
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking shorted the problem, and the machine sprang back to life.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm shorted the entire neighborhood, leaving everyone in the dark.

meanings.definition: To sell (a security) that one does not own
meanings.sent1: She shorted the stock to make a profit when the price dropped.
meanings.sent2: The investor shorted the company's shares before the market crash.
meanings.sent3: He shorted the bond, hoping to buy it back at a lower price later.
meanings.sent4: Shorting the security was a risky move, but it paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The trader shorted the currency, anticipating a decline in its value.

meanings.definition: To fall short of (a goal or expectation)
meanings.sent1: I shorted my target time by a few seconds in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team shorted their fundraising goal by a small margin.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to bake a cake from scratch shorted when it collapsed in the oven.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she shorted her potential by not pursuing her passion.
meanings.sent5: The singer shorted the high note, disappointing the audience.
